item.title: Falling fruits, 27th August
item.description:
At 41–43 Patterson Road, SE19 2LE, there are numerous fallen fruits on the pavement. This is causing accidents and creating a nuisance for local residents. The obstruction is also preventing wheelchair and pushchair access. Please arrange for a street cleaner to attend.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Cintra Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin not collected - council robbery tax paid, 27th August
item.description:
All of my neighbours had their bin collected apart from my bin which was refused to be collected Collect the bin or i will drop the garbage infront of your main office entrance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Hayfield Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Racially motivated graffiti across zebra crossing, 27th August
item.description:
Ignorant people have been painting the union jack and St George cross across the borough due to their incorrect and prejudiced opinions about immigration. Please clean up and deal with this incident quickly. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbish disposed of by entrance of 30 Stean Street, Zetland Apartments, 27th August
item.description:
Came back on Monday afternoon to find lots of rubbish dumped by entrance of 30 Stean Street. Some of the parcels have the address of a nearby neighbour. Please ask them to not dump rubbish by our entrance, it's unhygienic.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stean Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter bin and litter all the way on pavement to birkbeck railway bridge, 27th August
item.description:
This bin is full and overflowing. There is litter everywhere on the pavement all the way to the railway bridge. This problem was reported last Friday by others and has still not been addressed. I walk past this most days - the bin has still not emptied. Pedestrians are forced to walk through the litter given the placement of site office on the pavement for works to the birkbeck tram station ramp by tfl.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug dealings, 27th August
item.description:
There has been an increased number of drug dealings happening from here, please advise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cranswick Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Greenwich is a dump., 27th August
item.description:
King William Lane is a dumping ground, rubbish is routinely left here. Greenwich is a dump in General to be honest, and we are supposed to be a Royal Borough. Street sweeping used to be weekly, now I will be surprised if I see your cleaners monthly. The streets are filled with litter, the bins are always overflowing, council tax has gone up. Anyway I digress. Please routinely set a litter pick and sweep collection for this street King William Lane SE10 as it’s always full of rubbish and fly tipped materials. Trafalgar Road is a dump too, as are surrounding roads of Greenwich. Caradoc Street, Pelton Road, Greenwich full stop. What happened to your street sweepers?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King William Lane, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass bins full, 27th August
item.description:
The glass recycling bins in Fairfield road are full to overflowing with glass bottles and jar now being let in piles by the bin. It would appear that these bins have not been emptied on a weekly basis or the demand now exceeds the number of bins available.It seems always to be full to overflowing for the last 3 weeks. Please could you arrange for the bins and additional glass items to be removed and review the recycling capacity., Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnhill Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor Surface, 27th August
item.description:
Driving down Upton road with iris Avenue on your left as you go down the slope the surface is poor and not flat and uneven.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, London

item.title: Street light outside my house, 27th August
item.description:
There is a street light outside my house, it's very difficult to get my 4x4 in, because the lamppost is in this awkward place. Can something be done to move to another position to allow me more room. I have scratched my car already and I can't keep paying for damages. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Delaford Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
